executive_summary: Pop-up shops are becoming increasingly popular among businesses trying to expand brand awareness, test new markets and products, and develop consumer relationships. The 2020 pandemic played a major role in the industry's performance over recent years. Social distancing regulations and growing economic uncertainty have negatively impacted demand for pop-up shops, as consumers lowered discretionary spending. Although economic conditions improved over recent years, revenue gains in 2021 could not mitigate the losses from the remainder of the period. As a result, revenue has declined at an estimated CAGR of 0.7% to $15.6 billion over recent years, including a 1.2% gain in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Economic conditions over recent years have negatively impacted pop-up shops' performance. Products sold by pop-up shops are often discretionary in nature, as they are not as easily available as traditional retailers. This trend is less prominent among food vendors. The recovery from the pandemic, supply chain disruptions and high economic uncertainty led to significant inflationary pressure, lowering discretionary spending. Elevated interest rates have made real estate investments less attractive to retailers, incentivizing sellers to opt for pop-up shops. These shops enable retailers to study and test new markets at a lower cost.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic Harmed Pop-Up Stores' Sales
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Social distancing regulations and high economic uncertainty during the early stages of the pandemic caused demand to weaken as consumers aimed to prevent the spread of the virus and lowered discretionary spending. Pop-up shops could also operate in outdoor spaces. This prevented the industry from experiencing drastic losses during the pandemic and contributed to a quick recovery. Improving economic conditions during 2021 enabled revenue to jump, surpassing pre-pandemic levels. This is mainly attributed to pent-up demand and consumers becoming more confident.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pop-Up Shops Remain Popular Among Retailers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The rise of online shopping has left brick-and-mortar stores struggling to compete, pushing many retailers to downsize or close operations, leaving storefronts vacant and landlords without rent. This trend has accelerated since the pandemic, concluding that weakness in retail industries will persist after being dealt a significant blow and that pop-up shops are likely to continue operating. Retailers leverage pop-up shops as they are a cost-efficient alternative for retailers to expand operations and reach new markets. Following the pandemic, younger consumers have chosen to splurge on products for themselves, positively impacting the retail sector.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Economic conditions are forecast to improve over the coming years. Stabilizing inflation is likely to boost consumer confidence, positively impacting discretionary spending. The unemployment rate is also expected to fall. As more consumers are employed, consumer spending follows, creating opportunities for pop-up shops to boost sales. E-commerce will remain highly popular among consumers. Online retailers significantly threaten pop-up shops, causing revenue to grow slower than in previous years.

The state of the economy over the coming years will directly impact pop-up shops' performance. Pop-up shops are often subjected to higher rent prices, as they pay a premium for short-term leases. Rents are likely to determine whether it is cost-effective for any retailer to sign a long- or short-term lease. The Federal Reserve has paused interest rate increases, even hinting at possible interest rate drops over 2024. This, alongside significant commercial real estate vacancies, is likely to result in weakening rent costs, potentially.

industry_definition: Pop-up shops run temporary retail spaces for an established period of days or weeks before closing down and moving to another location. Brands often leverage these shops to enter new markets, offer a unique shopping experience and test new products.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: Unfavorable economic conditions hinder revenue growth
High interest rates push rent costs higher
Individual consumers are the largest market for pop-up shops
Household goods are largely popular among consumers
Pop-up shop performance relies directly on consumer behavior.
Retailers can easily enter the industry.
Pop-up shops are temporary retail locations.
Purchase costs represent the largest expense for retailers.
Profit fluctuates based on economic conditions.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Households and individual consumers generate the highest share of revenue, as pop-up shops are meant to target individual buyers. Demand from consumers fluctuates based on various macroeconomic factors. High unemployment, weakening consumer spending, high inflation and falling consumer confidence have prevented this segment from expanding. Favorable economic conditions are likely to continue driving the growth of this industry, mainly driven by growing consumer spending.

Other customers, including other businesses and wholesalers, also purchase products from pop-up shops at a significantly lower rate. Businesses purchasing retail products for their own use comprise a small market for retailers. Another practice within this sector is for other retailers, wholesalers and distributors to purchase merchandise from pop-up shops for resale. This trend is significantly less common for pop-up shops as they maintain lower inventory than traditional brick-and-mortar shops.

Other customers, including other businesses and wholesalers, also purchase products from pop-up shops at a significantly lower rate. Another practice within this sector is for other retailers, wholesalers and distributors to purchase merchandise from pop-up shops for resale.

Other customers, including other businesses and wholesalers, also purchase products from pop-up shops at a significantly lower rate. Another practice within this sector is for other retailers, wholesalers and distributors to purchase merchandise from pop-up shops for resale.

products_and_services.product_description: Household products generate the highest share of revenue. This segment includes furniture, antiques, collectibles, artwork, books and other home products.

Food and beverage pop-up shops are highly common. These locations can include farmers' markets, food halls and street fairs. Food sellers can leverage these shops to reach a new audience, test new products and build a positive reputation among consumers. Many food and beverage businesses use pop-up shops as a stepping stone to opening their own storefront.

Other products include hardware, sporting gear and other consumer goods. Demand for other products is heavily dependent on changes in macroeconomic conditions, as consumers increase non-necessary spending when economic conditions are favorable. On the other hand, buyers are discouraged from purchasing discretionary products during times of high inflation and high economic uncertainty.

Demand for clothing and jewelry is on the rise. These shops often sell smaller products rather than larger pieces, such as furniture, because they are significantly easier to transport and set up. Younger consumers are increasingly favoring clothing and jewelry retailers as, according to a McKinsey report, they plan to splurge more on fashion. This trend has enabled demand for apparel and accessories to account for a larger share of revenue. Pop-up shops help apparel retailers create brand awareness and grow their clientele through exposure, making it attractive for growing brands.

tier_2_suppliers: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumer spending will dictate general demand for industry establishments. As consumer spending rises, total dollars spent on discretionary and nondiscretionary goods rise, including products sold at industry establishments.
E-commerce sales represent the total value of goods sold via online channels. As e-commerce sales rise, competition for pop-up shops grows, since they revolve around physical retail locations.
Elevated interest rates ripple through the remainder of the economy, causing interest rates to rise for most consumers as well. This drives the cost of debt and pushes up rents.

As consumers grow uncertain about the future state of the economy, they become increasingly price-conscious. As a result, consumers lower spending at pop-up shops and focus their resources on essential or more affordable products.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Retailers can easily enter the industry. Pop-up shops often require fewer products than a traditional brick-and-mortar store, lowering initial costs.
Pop-up shops face few regulations, making it easy for new companies to enter the industry.

basis_points.basis_description: Consumers have multiple retail alternatives. Buyers can opt to purchase products directly from traditional or online retailers, as these can be more convenient and easier to access.

Pop-up shop performance relies directly on consumer behavior. Since consumers have multiple alternatives for retailers, demand for pop-up shops is directly impacted by consumer preferences, resulting in high buyer power.
Pop-up shops also need to meet quality standards to attract buyers, preventing them from freely changing suppliers and leading to moderate supplier power.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Pop-up shops are temporary retail locations. Since the stores are in a given location for a limited time, there are no major companies dominating the industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: THE NEED FOR INVENTORY DRIVES PURCHASE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs tend to hover near 50.0% of revenue due to the fact that this industry, like other retail industries, must purchase inventory.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: POP-UP SHOPS CONTINUE TO RELY ON LABOR
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Industry wages are comparable to other retail industries as labor requirements differ from the rest of the sector.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations. A low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur, just that the likelihood of some innovation materializing as a threat is lower. However, the concentration of technologies is high in this industry. This suggests that industry operators have exposure to potentially unforeseen areas of innovation.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Changes in Consumer Behavior Impact Sales
volatility_points.volatility_description: The 2020 pandemic took a direct hit on revenue. This can be attributed to social distancing regulations, growing consumer uncertainty and weaker consumer spending.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Household products generate the highest share of revenue. This segment includes furniture, antiques, collectibles, artwork, books and other home products.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: DEMAND FOR CLOTHING AND JEWELRY IS ON THE RISE
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Younger consumers are increasingly favoring clothing and jewelry retailers as, according to a McKinsey report, they plan to splurge more on fashion.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Food and Beverage Shops Benefit from Exposure
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Food and beverage pop-up shops are highly common. These locations can include farmers' markets, food halls and street fairs.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Other Products are Less Popular Among Consumers
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Other products include hardware, sporting gear and other consumer goods.

FAQs.question: What are some key changes in consumer behavior that impacted sales?
FAQs.answer: The 2020 pandemic led to social distancing regulations, growing consumer uncertainty and weaker consumer spending, which took a direct hit on revenue. Elevated inflation during 2022 and 2023 discouraged consumers from making discretionary purchases, harming demand for pop-up shops. The rise of online shopping also weakened demand for pop-up shops.
